overview.description: The temple sits in the heart of the Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve, the largest tiger reserve in India. The landscape where rugged geology, verdant biodiversity, and ancient architecture merge creates what devotees call 'Kailasa on Earth.'

tiger_reserve.name: Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve (NSTR)
tiger_reserve.note: The historical need for high temple walls was partly to protect pilgrims from these wild animals

krishna_river.significance: Sacred river believed to have curative properties
krishna_river.flow_direction: Sharp northward turn at Srisailam (Uttaravahini - considered auspicious)
krishna_river.properties: Waters believed curative due to medicinal plants in the catchment area
krishna_river.ritual: Pilgrims bathe here before temple darshan

submerged_shrine.status: Underwater most of year, resurfaces briefly in summer when water levels drop
submerged_shrine.note: Pilgrims flock to see it during this brief window
